title: Atomic Layer Etching Process Schema
description: A JSON schema representing the Atomic Layer Etching process, including its inputs, parameters, and outputs.

inputs.description: The primary inputs to the ALE process.

items.description: Halogen-based gases such as chlorine (Cl2) or hydrogen fluoride (HF), or plasma species in the case of plasma-enhanced ALE.

externalEnergySource.description: Thermal energy for thermal ALE or plasma excitation for plasma ALE.

substrateMaterial.description: The target material to be etched, which can be a semiconductor, dielectric, or metal film.

chlorinationEnergy.description: The energy used for chlorination of the substrate surface.

reactantChemicals.description: The first and second pulse reactants used in the ALE process.

firstPulseReactant.description: The chemical used in the first pulse to functionalize the surface and act as a mild oxidizing agent.

secondPulseReactant.description: The chemical used in the second pulse to etch the propene-modified surface Co atoms.

parameters.description: Process parameters that must be carefully controlled to maintain process stability and efficiency.

items.description: Gas flow rates for each precursor.

fluorineMolecules.description: Number of fluorine molecules used in the etching process.

surfaceCoverage.description: Surface coverage of fluorine atoms on the MoS2 surface.

chlorinationDepth.description: The depth of chlorination penetration into the substrate surface.

surfaceStability.description: Stability of the substrate surface during the etching process.

processWindow.description: The pressure-temperature process window for the ALE process.

reactantPressure.description: The reactant pressure used in the ALE process.

productPressure.description: The product pressure used in the ALE process.

temperatureRange.description: The temperature range for the ALE process.

outputs.description: The outputs of the ALE process, including the etched material and by-products.

items.description: Volatile compounds produced during the ALE process.
Species desorbed from the substrate surface during the etching process.
Chemical etching products formed during the ALE process, such as GeCl, GeCl2, and GeCl3.

simulationParameters.description: Simulation parameters used to model and optimize the ALE process.

items.description: Investigation into the underlying mechanisms that drive ALE processes.

excitationDynamics.description: Study of the effects of photon excitation on reaction mechanisms and energies.

surfaceStability.description: Stability of the substrate surface during the etching process.

chlorinationEnergyThreshold.description: The threshold energy for chlorination required for etching to occur.

bombardmentEnergyThreshold.description: The threshold energy for bombardment required for etching to occur.

aleProcess.description: The ALE process, including the fluorination and ligand-exchange reactions.

fluorinationReaction.description: The fluorination reaction, including the fluorine radicals and the GaN surface.

items.description: The fluorine radicals involved in the fluorination reaction.

galliumNitrideSurface.description: The GaN surface involved in the fluorination reaction.

ligandExchangeReaction.description: The ligand-exchange reaction, including the GaF3 and TMA molecules.

galliumFluoride.description: The GaF3 molecule involved in the ligand-exchange reaction.

trimethylAluminum.description: The TMA molecule involved in the ligand-exchange reaction.

hfPulse.description: The HF pulse in the thermal ALE process.

items.description: The HF molecules involved in the HF pulse.

surfaceCoverage.description: The surface coverage of HF molecules on the alumina surface.

bindingEnergy.description: The binding energy of HF molecules on the alumina surface.

desorptionEnergy.description: The desorption energy of HF molecules from the alumina surface.

ionBombardment.description: The ion bombardment step in the ALE process.

ionEnergy.description: The energy of the ion bombarding the surface.

ionDose.description: The dose of ions bombarding the surface.

surfaceDamage.description: The extent of surface damage caused by the ion bombardment.

simulationResults.description: Simulation results, including etch per cycle, etch products, and surface coverage.

etchPerCycle.description: Etch per cycle as a function of ion energy.

items.description: Etch products formed during the ALE process.

coordinationNumbers.description: Distribution of coordination numbers for Hf and O atoms in the bulk amorphous HfO2 model.

adsorptionEnergy.description: Adsorption energy of HF molecules on the bare surface of amorphous HfO2.

bindingEnergy.description: Binding energy per surface area of the material.

surfaceCoverage.description: Surface coverage of HF molecules on the amorphous HfO2 surface.

etchRate.description: Theoretical etch rate for amorphous HfO2.
